intro: Laurentia michelii f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered laurentia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, textured surface. This variety is distinguished by its notably white flowers, which set it apart from other forms of Laurentia michelii.
